Package cea.federated.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
cea.federated.client.Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
OfflineClient
public class Client extends Object
Implementation of the distributed layer built on top of the STREAMER instance. It allows a connection with the server to get its instructions.

  • Field Details

    • logger

      public final org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
      Logger of the client.

    • id

      public final String id
      Identifier of the client.

    • isOnline

      public boolean isOnline
      Boolean that determines if the client is online or not. In case of offline, the rest of STREAMER modules won't be used. (default=false)

    • isPassive

      public boolean isPassive
      Boolean that determines if the client is passive or not. if passive, the training is disabled, and it only retrieves the updated model and uses it for inference. (default=false)

    • recordsDB

      public Vector<TimeRecord> recordsDB
      Database of the records. Only used if isOnline=true. (default=null)

    • data_type

      public String data_type
      The way of storing the data for the ml python algorithm. (default=redis, option=redis/pickle)

    • python_file_path

      public String python_file_path
      Path of the ml python algorithm.

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client(String id, String python_file_path)
      Constructor of the object 'client'.
      Parameters:
      id - Identifier of the client.
      python_file_path - Path of the ml python algorithm.

  • Method Details

    • start_client

      public void start_client(String server_address)
      Starts the client gRPC interface. Then, the client will listen to the server orders and follow its instruction. The server will determine which step to perform, as for instances initialize the model, fit it, evaluate it, or just replace it.
      Parameters:
      server_address - Address of the server needed to establish the connection.

    • initialize_client

      public Object initialize_client()
      Initializes the model by executing the python file with the tag 'init'.
      Returns:
      Initialized model.

    • fit_client

      public Object fit_client(String parameters)
      Fits the model by executing the python file with the tag 'train'.
      Parameters:
      parameters - Parameters of the model.
      Returns:
      Fitted Model.

    • update_model

      public void update_model(String parameters)
      Replaces/updates the actual client model parameters by storing the server model parameters in redis.
      Parameters:
      parameters - Parameters of the model.

    • evaluate_client

      public double evaluate_client(String parameters)
      Evaluates the model by executing the python file with the tag 'evaluate'. For the moment, the loss is the only one metric that is returned by the evaluation step, but it will soon be extended to others.
      Parameters:
      parameters - Parameters of the model.
      Returns:
      Loss information.
